style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)
style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Some of the best strong examples have the taste and aroma of an aged Calvados (apple brandy from northern France), while subtle, dry versions can taste similar to many fine white wines.

breweries.name: Northville Winery & Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Our year round tasting room opened in June 2012. We have wine, hard cider and beer tasting, wine, hard cider and beer by the glass, outdoor seating and live acoustic music. The Northville Winery originated across the parking lot in Parmenters Northville Cider Mill in 1982. Rob and Carina Nelson started making their own wine over 5 years ago and they have been expanding ever since, including adding a microbrewery this year. All of our grapes and apples are brought in from the West side of Michigan. We then do all the pressing in the cider mill and fermenting and bottling in the winery building. Every bottle is filled and labeled by hand. The winery produces several alcoholic wines, hard cider flavors and most recently BEER! We are also adding a small distillery soon!

data.name: Apple Pie
data.description: Dessert in a glass. Holidays in a glass. Americana in a glass. Apple pie mead is the taste of everything we love celebrating.  A simple combination of local fresh apple cider from Hugus Farms in Rushville, Ohio, and our local wildflower honey with the addition of the quintessential American Pie spices – cinnamon, nutmeg & clove.

style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)
style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Some of the best strong examples have the taste and aroma of an aged Calvados (apple brandy from northern France), while subtle, dry versions can taste similar to many fine white wines.

breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery
breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!

breweries.name: Vander Mill Winery, Cider Mill & Microbrewery
breweries.nameShortDisplay: Vander Mill Winery, Cider Mill & Microbrewery
breweries.description:
With humble beginnings as a cider mill in 2006 with a 5,000-square-foot building, Vander Mill began distributing their cider products in 750 ml. glass bottles in 2008 and in draft kegs.

Vander Mill is now distributing their hard cider varieties in convenience and grocery stores, bars, and restaurants throughout Michigan, Illinois, Indiana and Ohio.

“We are going to continue our focus on innovation and creativity with our ciders,” Paul Vander Heide, Owner, said. “But we wanted to take a few of our core products and make them more accessible to customers.”

data.name: Bluesberry
data.description: Our tart, wild yeast influenced, blueberry cyser, blended with skin contact fermented blueberries.  Dry and funk forward with a lingering fruitiness that’s sure cure for the blues.

breweries.name: Millstone Cellars
breweries.description: From Farm to Bottle; we source local raw honey, fruits and apples to handcraft intriguing ciders and meads.

data.name: Bonfire
data.description: Hot Cyser 70% Applewine 30% Honeywine with Fish Peppers. Blending cold smoked fish peppers into our barrel aged cyser crafted from local heirloom apples and wildflower honey. Concocting a warming libation, perfectly balancing spicy, fruity, and earthy flavors to help stave off the cold.

breweries.name: The Saint Louis Brewery (Schlafly)
breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

data.name: Enchanted Horse
data.description: The crisp taste of cider. The sweet flavor of mead. What better way to experience the best of both worlds than upon the back of the Enchanted Horse. This award winner serves up the ideal blend of Michigan Honeycrisp Apple Cider and local wildflower honey to create a Cyser intent on satisfying the most discerning tastes. Sit back, relax and invigorate your senses with this perfect combination of nectar and fruit.

style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)

Some of the best strong examples have the taste and aroma of an aged Calvados (apple brandy from northern France), while subtle, dry versions can taste similar to many fine white wines.

breweries.name: Arktos Meadery
breweries.description:
For more than 9,000 years, the fermentation of honey has helped define culture and shape history. Early Slavic trading, Norse Mythology, Vedic Hymns of India, Old English Epics, 19th century Russian Literature, all of these acts or works, not to mention the contemplations of many a great mind of ancient Greece, have taken part in documenting and contributing to the continuing history of what we commonly refer to as Honey Wine or Mead making.

Arktos Meadery is now one more step in this evolutionary process. Nature has so graciously provided us with all the ingredients necessary for the production of this Nectar of the Gods. Now it is our responsibility to take these fruits, spices, and yeasts and combine them with those two wonderfully simple ingredients of honey and water for the purpose of continuing the hallowed tradition of making mead.

It is our hope and intention to provide each and every one of our mead drinkers with the finest, simplest and most natural mead possible. Oh, that sweet, sweet nectar…

data.name: Grappler
data.description: How many apples are in a grappler? It’s a common question we get. While we can't give you an exact answer, we can tell you that our Grappler is full of apples. Delicious, tangy, juicy apples, that is!

style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)
style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Some of the best strong examples have the taste and aroma of an aged Calvados (apple brandy from northern France), while subtle, dry versions can taste similar to many fine white wines.

breweries.name: Kinney Creek Brewery
breweries.description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

data.name: Hoppy Granny
data.description: A Cyser by definition, it is a strong cider based on our Crabby Granny blend, with lots of traditional crab apples, Granny Smith & Winesap, then balanced with sweet desert and aromatic apples. Tartness up front with wildflower and clover honey to provide a smooth finish. We turn it into the Hoppy Granny by dry hopping it with a salad of the C's - Citra, Centennial, Chinook, Cascade.

style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)
style.description: In well-made examples of the style, the fruit is both distinctive and well-incorporated into the honey-sweet-acid-tannin-alcohol balance of the mead. Some of the best strong examples have the taste and aroma of an aged Calvados (apple brandy from northern France), while subtle, dry versions can taste similar to many fine white wines.

breweries.name: Frecon's Cidery
breweries.description:
Frecon's Cidery is a family & friend owned estate cidery located in Berks County, Pennsylvania. We make traditional cider using classic techniques & use apples from our family orchard, which as been growing quality tree fruits since 1944.

Using a blend of dessert, cider & aromatic apples, both heirloom & modern, our cider makers select the best balances to ferment into the final product. We're proud to continue an American tradition of fine ciders that feature great aroma & flavor, recently recognized with a bronze medal by the Great Lakes Cider & Perry Association.

breweries.name: Acoustic Draft Mead
breweries.description: BzZz Loves You

data.name: Puff The Magic Cyser
data.description:
Puff the Magic Cyser is a collaborative barrel aged product between Vander Mill and New Holland Brewing Company.

This cyser is fermented with Michigan wildflower honey to complete dryness and then aged in New Holland Dragon's Milk barrels for 8 months.  The richness from the stout and depth of the barrel flavor make this product very complex.  A hint of the honey and acidity of the cider round out the profile.

breweries.name: New Holland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
New Holland Brewing Company’s deep roots in the craft industry go back to 1997. Our role as an integral member of the artisan approach is something we take seriously, yet engage lightheartedly.

We believe the art of craft lives in fostering rich experiences for our customers, through creating authentic beer, spirits and food while providing great service. Recognized for our creativity and artistry, our mission to improve the lives of craft consumers everywhere is seen in our diverse, balanced collection of beer and spirits.

locations.name: Production Facility
locations.hoursOfOperation: Brewery tours are at Noon and 3pm. Tours are $10 per person and include samples of our beer as well as a take-home New Holland pint glass.

breweries.name: B. Nektar Meadery
breweries.description:
Known for the most amazing and creative alcoholic beverages made from honey. B. Nektar is a world-wide sensation.

To boldly go where no meadery has gone before. To prove to you that the horrible mead your best friend made one time in college is NOT what a good mead should taste like. To show you that mead doesn't HAVE to be sweet. To educate you on the different styles of mead. To bring mead into the mainstream, but still maintain our integrity. To everyday thank my mom and tell her that I love her (shouldn't we all?).

data.name: Spiced Apple Cyser
data.description: Spiced Apple Cyser is a sweet mead crafted with 100% raw Ohio wildflower honey, fresh Ohio apple cider, spices, and yeast.  This apple pie-inspired cyser can be enjoyed year round, but with cinnamon and nutmeg notes, is always a treat when the air becomes crisp and the holidays approach.

style.name: Cyser (Apple Melomel)

breweries.name: Crafted Artisan Meadery
breweries.description: Located in rural Northeast Ohio Crafted Artisan Meadery specializes in award-winning handcrafted Mead.  Through the labors of the honeybees and flora around us we transform their work into one of the oldest fermented beverages in the world. We use the finest locally sourced ingredients and pride ourselves on providing the highest quality Mead to our customers.  Taste something Crafted!

breweries.name: Mackinaw Trail Brewing Company
breweries.description: Mackinaw Trail Brewing Company has established itself as a premier Microbrewery in the Northern Michigan Area. Currently including eight beers on tap and two hard ciders, plans to expand to twenty taps are already in motion. Whether you come to taste by the sample glass, pint, snifter, or take home a custom Yelper, Howler, or Growler, MTB should have something for everyone! Be on the look out for ‘Fudged Up’ stout in 22 oz crown cap Belgian bottles in early 2015.

data.name: The Crabby Granny
data.description: Our cyser! A strong cider blended with lots of traditional crab apples, Granny Smith and Winesap, then balanced with sweet desert and aromatic apples. Tartness up front with wildflower and clover honey to provide a smooth finish. Bottle conditioned for a light effervescence. GLUTEN FREE!
